result.execSummary:
The defendant Rayel J. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Upon successful completion of sentence, the record shall be expunged pursuant to 973.015. Expungement is conditioned upon all court obligations being paid in full AND proof of completion/obtained GED/HSED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Jury trial on June 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rayel J. Smith in court with attorney Ramneek Singh Button.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Button heard - DA is Klomberg, both are requesting new JT date and possible scheduling conference date; Court resets JT date; bond cont.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

12:53 - Defendant Rayel J. Smith in court, in custody with attorney Ramneek Singh Button (eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Return date scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
